abstract: The consumer products company claims that customers will confuse Willa, a fledgling line of skin care products for young girls, with Wella, its hair care line.
snippet: The consumer products company claims that customers will confuse Willa, a fledgling line of skin care products for young girls, with Wella, its hair care line.
lead_paragraph: A light bulb went off for Christy Prunier while giving her 8-year-old daughter, Willa, a bath. The girl complained that she didn’t like “babyish” soaps anymore.

headline.main: A Start-Up Takes On Procter & Gamble Over a Name

byline.original: By Peter Lattman and Andrew Martin
